observation: Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association | BHMA  We use cookies We use cookies and other tracking technologies to improve your browsing experience on our website, to show you personalized content and targeted ads, to analyze our website traffic, and to understand where our visitors are coming from. Hudnut Distinguished Service Award BHMA Launches Codes Report This edition of Codes In Context is the first in a series of reports that provide relevant hardware changes and updates during the various code cycles. Learn More Be safe. Be secure. Look for the mark. BHMA is the only organization accredited by ANSI to develop and maintain performance standards for locks, closers, exit devices and other builders hardware. The BHMA Certified® Products Directory (CPD) lists all products that have been certified to meet ANSI/BHMA standards. Product Grade LEVELS Product grades (1, 2 or 3) for hardware items are defined within most ANSI/BHMA standards. Prev Next BHMA Spotlight Series: Justin Crotzer Name Title Series Topic Standards Get Certified BHMA makes it easy to understand ANSI/BHMA A 156 series standards. Get quick, one-page summaries through our Hardware Highlights series. Testing Manufacturers voluntarily submit a hardware product to independent laboratory testing to confirm that the product fully meets the criteria of its ANSI/BHMA standard. Testing is conducted on a regular basis. A security test is shown here. Secure Home™ The BHMA® Secure Home™ Label helps residential contractors and homeowners purchase the best hardware for their needs by testing to these three areas: security, durability and finish. Search BHMA Certified® Products For complete listings of BHMA Certified® Products, view the BHMA Certified® Products Directory (CPD). The listings in this directory are performance-oriented standards having cycle, operational, strength, security, and finish test requirements. Search Now Participate in the BHMA® Certification Program by voluntarily submitting a hardware product to independent laboratory testing to confirm that it fully meets the criteria of the appropriate ANSI/BHMA® standard.  This industry-wide certification program does not call for a manufacturer to be a BHMA® member in order to certify its products. 529 14th Street, NW, Suite 1280 Phone: 212 297 2122 bhma@kellencompany.com © Copyright 2024 Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association Privacy Policy Terms and Conditions

thought: The website seems to be related to hardware manufacturers and industry standards, which is not consistent with the characteristics of a scam website. It does not exhibit any of the typical red flags of a scam website such as unusually low prices, psychological manipulation, non-existent companies, or ambiguous privacy policies. The URL http://buildershardware.com/ is not a scam website.
